Line 26: Line 26:
The Ubuntu One service is similar to services such as [[iDisk]], [[Dropbox (storage provider)|Dropbox]], [[Box.net]], [[Mozy]], [[Wuala]], [[Humyo]] and [[Live Mesh]]. Its client code is implemented in [[Python (programming language)|Python]]. It uses [[Twisted (software)|Twisted]] for its low-level networking and [[Protocol Buffers]] for protocol description.
The Ubuntu One service is similar to services such as [[iDisk]], [[Dropbox (storage provider)|Dropbox]], [[Box.net]], [[Mozy]], [[Wuala]], [[Humyo]] and [[Live Mesh]]. Its client code is implemented in [[Python (programming language)|Python]]. It uses [[Twisted (software)|Twisted]] for its low-level networking and [[Protocol Buffers]] for protocol description.
â
What sets Ubuntu One apart from the other similar service providers are additional features like the integration with other services. Examples of these features are integration with [[Evolution mail|Evolution]] for contacts and with [[Tomboy (software)|Tomboy]] for notes due to the access to the local [[CouchDB]] instance <ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.linux-magazine.com/Online/News/Relaxed-Ubuntu-9.10-CouchDB-to-be-Integrated |title=Relaxed Ubuntu 9.10: CouchDB to be Integrated - Linux Magazine Online |publisher=Linux-magazine.com |date=2009-10-15 |accessdate=2010-01-26}}</ref>. Further possibilities include the capability of editing the contacts, as well as the Tomboy notes, online via the Ubuntu One Web interface; syncing contacts with mobile devices (in partnership with [[Funambol]]); and purchasing [[DRM]]-free music while syncing them automatically with your Ubuntu One Account via the Ubuntu One Music Store (in partnership with [[7digital]]).
+
What sets Ubuntu One apart from the other similar service providers are additional features like the integration with other services. Examples of these features are integration with [[Evolution mail|Evolution]] for contacts and with [[Tomboy (software)|Tomboy]] for notes due to the access to the local [[CouchDB]] instance <ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.linux-magazine.com/Online/News/Relaxed-Ubuntu-9.10-CouchDB-to-be-Integrated |title=Relaxed Ubuntu 9.10: CouchDB to be Integrated - Linux Magazine Online |publisher=Linux-magazine.com |date=2009-10-15 |accessdate=2010-01-26}}</ref>. Further possibilities include the capability of editing the contacts, as well as the Tomboy notes, online via the Ubuntu One Web interface; syncing contacts with mobile devices (in partnership with [[Funambol]]); and purchasing [[Digital rights management|DRM]]-free music while syncing them automatically with your Ubuntu One Account via the Ubuntu One Music Store (in partnership with [[7digital]]).
Currently there are more features planned like enabling users to share files over the local network (instead of using the Ubuntu One Cloud), or synchronizing Firefox Bookmarks with Ubuntu One<ref>https://wiki.ubuntu.com/DesktopTeam/Specs/Karmic/IntegratingWithUbuntuOne</ref>.
Currently there are more features planned like enabling users to share files over the local network (instead of using the Ubuntu One Cloud), or synchronizing Firefox Bookmarks with Ubuntu One<ref>https://wiki.ubuntu.com/DesktopTeam/Specs/Karmic/IntegratingWithUbuntuOne</ref>.
